subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul writes: I myself am convinced, my brothers, that you yourselves are full of goodness, complete in knowledge and competent to instruct one another. I have written you quite boldly on some points, as if to remind you of them again, because of the grace God gave me to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles with the priestly duty of proclaiming the gospel of God, so that the Gentiles might become an offering acceptable to God, sanctified by the Holy Spirit. Therefore I glorify in Christ Jesus in my service to God. (Romans 15:14-17) NIV
reflection: We see here that Paul was very enthusiastic about what God had done through him. Being proud of God's God work is not a sin ~ it is worship. If you are not sure whether your pride is selfish or not, ask yourself this question: Am I just as proud of what God is doing through other people as of what He is doing through me?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember, that the spread of the Gospel is through the power of Your Holy Spirit, not by any power I may poses. I pray that I may never get in the way of Your Spirit's work. Bless and keep all my friends safe and healthy. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~(food for thought)~~When believing in Christ you will experience miracles...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul writes: I myself am convinced, my brothers, that you yourselves
are full of goodness, complete in knowledge and competent to instruct
one another...

I have written you quite boldly on some points, as if to remind you of
them again, because of the grace God gave me

to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles with the priestly duty of
proclaiming the gospel of God, so that the Gentiles might become an
offering acceptable to God, sanctified by the Holy Spirit...

Therefore I glorify in Christ Jesus in my service to God ...(Ro. 15:14-17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We see here that Paul was very enthusiastic about what God had
done through him...

Being proud of God's God work is not a sin ~ it is worship...

If you are not sure whether your pride is selfish or not, ask yourself 
this question: Am I just as proud of what God is doing through other 
people as of what He is doing through me?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember, that the spread 
of the Gospel is through the power of Your Holy Spirit, not by any power
I may poses. I pray that I may never get in the way of Your Spirit's work.
Bless and keep all my e-mail friends safe and healthy...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is there to lead you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It has always been my ambition to preach the Gospel where Christ was not known, so that I would not be building on someone else's foundation. Rather, as it is written: "Those who were not told about Him will see, and those who have not heard will understand." This is why I have often been hindered from coming to you. (Romans 15:20-22) NIV
reflection: Paul's natural desire was to visit the church at Rome, but he had delayed his visit because he had heard many good reports about the believers there and knew they were doing well on their own. It was more important for him to preach in areas that had not yet heard the Good News. Do you reach out as you should ~ or ~ do you restrict your fellowship to other believers.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, open the door to someone today that needs to hear the Gospel. Guide me down the path you want me to travel. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God is with us in our weakness (I Cor. 2:4)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

It has always been my ambition to preach the Gospel where Christ
was not known, so that I would not be building on someone else's 
foundation...

Rather, as it is written: "Those who were not told about Him will
see, and those who have not heard will understand."

This is why I have often been hindered from coming to you...(Ro. 15:20-22) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul's natural desire was to visit the church at Rome, but he had
delayed his visit because he had heard many good reports about
the believers there and knew they were doing well on their own...

It was more important for him to preach in areas that had not yet
heard the Good News...

Do you reach out as you should ~ or ~ do you restrict your
fellowship to other believers...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, open the door to someone today
that needs to hear the Gospel. Guide me down the path
you want me to travel...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will lead to the one He has prepared...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I urge you, brothers, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of the Spirit, to join me in my struggle by praying to God for me. Pray that I may be rescued from the unbelievers in Judea and that my service in Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints there, so that by God's will I may come to you with joy and together with you be refreshed ~ The God of peace be with you all. Amen. (Romans 15:30-33) NIV
reflection: Too often we view prayer as a time of comfort, reflection, or making our requests known to God. But here Paul urges believers to join in his struggle by means of prayer. Prayer is also a weapon in all believers' armor as we intercede for others who join in the fight against Satan. Do your prayers reflect that urgency???
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that your hand of protection would be upon every believer who is struggling under Satan's schemes. Give us the added strength to stand up against him at all times. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~All we have is a gift from God...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

I urge you, brothers, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of 
the Spirit, to join me in my struggle by praying to God for me...

Pray that I may be rescued from the unbelievers in Judea and
that my service in Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints
there,

so that by God's will I may come to you with joy and together with 
you be refreshed ~ The God of peace be with you all. Amen.
(Ro. 15:30-33) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Too often we view prayer as a time of comfort, reflection, or making
our requests known to God. But here Paul urges believers to join in
his struggle by means of prayer...

Prayer is also a weapon in all believers' armor as we intercede for
others who join in the fight against Satan...

Do your prayers reflect that urgency???

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that your hand of protection would
be upon every believer who is struggling under Satan's schemes.
Give us the added strength to stand up against him at all times...Amen.

Keep looking up, for strength to fight the good fight...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Paul's final instruction) I urge you brothers, to watch out for those who cause divisions and put obstacles in your way that are contrary to the teaching you have learned. Keep away from them. For such people are not serving our Lord Christ, but their own appetites. by smooth talk and flattery they deceive the minds of naive people. (Romans 16:17, 18) NIV
reflection: When we read books or listen to sermons, we should check the content of what is written or said so that we won't be fooled by smooth talk and glowing words. Christians who study God's Word, asking Him to reveal the truth, will not be fooled, but nominal Christians may be easily taken in. In Acts 17:10-12 we have an example of believers who carefully checked God's Word ~ read it.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always compare what I hear with what Your Word says, so that I will not be deceived. Give me godly-wisdom, that I may always remain faithful to You. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be wise onto salvation...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
(Paul's final instruction)

I urge you brothers, to watch out for those who cause divisions 
and put obstacles in your way that are contrary to the teaching
you have learned. Keep away from them...

For such people are not serving our Lord Christ, but their own
appetites. by smooth talk and flattery they deceive the minds
of naive people...(Ro. 16:17, 18) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When we read books or listen to sermons, we should check the 
content of what is written or said so that we won't be fooled by
smooth talk and glowing words...

Christians who study God's Word, asking Him to reveal the truth,
will not be fooled, but nominal Christians may be easily taken in.

In Acts 17:10-12 we have an example of believers who carefully
checked God's Word ~ read it...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always compare what I
hear with what Your Word says, so that I will not be deceived.
Give me godly-wisdom, that I may always remain faithful to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will make you wise onto salvation...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now to him who is able to establish you by my gospel and the proclamation of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery hidden for long ages past, but now revealed and made known through the prophetic writings by the command of the eternal God, so that all nations might believe in Him, to the only wise God be glory forever through Jesus Christ! Amen. (Romans 16:25-27) NIV
reflection: As Jerusalem was the center of Jewish life, Rome was the world's political, religious, social, and economic center. There the major governmental decisions were made, and from there the Good News spread to the ends of the earth. Paul had not yet been to Rome to meet all the Christians there, and, of course, he has not yet met us. We, too, live in a cosmopolitan setting with the entire world open to us. We also have the potential for both widespread influence and wrenching conflict. We need to listen carefully to Paul's teaching about unity, service, and love so we may apply them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me to grow in faith so that I would become faithful in the spreading of Your Word as Paul was. Use me in a great and mighty way, so that I may glorify Your name. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~How are you helping the Word to grow?

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Now to him who is able to establish you by my gospel and the 
proclamation of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the
mystery hidden for long ages past,

but now revealed and made known through the prophetic writings
by the command of the eternal God, so that all nations might believe
in Him,

to the only wise God be glory forever through Jesus Christ! Amen.
(Ro. 16:25-27) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

As Jerusalem was the center of Jewish life, Rome was the world's
political, religious, social, and economic center...

There the major governmental decisions were made, and from there
the Good News spread to the ends of the earth...

Paul had not yet been to Rome to meet all the Christians there, and,
of course, he has not yet met us. We, too, live in a cosmopolitan setting
with the entire world open to us...

We also have the potential for both widespread influence and wrenching
conflict. We need to listen carefully to Paul's teaching about unity, service,
and love so we may apply them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me to grow in faith so
that I would become faithful in the spreading of Your Word as Paul was.
Use me in a great and mighty way, so that I may glorify Your name...Amen.

Keep looking up, be useable in the spreading of the Word...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I was undecided as to what book to do for the next devotional but I enjoy Paul's letters so I decided to follow with I Corinthians. Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes. (I Corinthians 1:1) NIV
reflection: As is very plain here, we see that Paul was give a special calling from God to preach about Jesus Christ. The calling of every Christian is not always so obvious ~ But each Christian has a job to do ~ A role to take ~ or a contribution to make. One assignment may seem more spectacular than another ~ but all are necessary to carry out God's greater plans for His church ~ and for His world see (I Corinthians 12:12-27). The most important thing is that we remain available to God by placing our gifts at His service ~ Then as you discover what He calls you to do, be ready to do it.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always remain available, for I know that you will equip me for the task you have for me. Bless all my e-mail friends today with good health. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Poverty of purpose is worse 
than poverty of purse...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
I was undecided as to what book to do for the next devotional 
but I enjoy Paul's letters so I decided to follow with I Corinthians...

Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God,
and our brother Sosthenes. (I Cor. 1:1) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

As is very plain here, we see that Paul was give a special calling
from God to preach about Jesus Christ...

The calling of every Christian is not always so obvious ~ But each 
Christian has a job to do ~ A role to take ~ or a contribution to make...

One assignment may seem more spectacular than another ~ but
all are necessary to carry out God's greater plans for His church ~
and for His world see (I Cor. 12:12-27)...

The most important thing is that we remain available to God by
placing our gifts at His service ~ Then as you discover what He 
calls you to do, be ready to do it...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always remain available,
for I know that you will equip me for the task you have for me.
Bless all my e-mail friends today with good health...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will make His will known...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ. (I Corinthians 1:3)
reflection: As we think about this letter of Paul's we see a quite different greeting than what we use in our letters today. But what a wonderful greeting it would be to be reminded of God's wonderful grace. Grace is God's free gift of salvation given to us in Christ. Receiving it brings us peace (Romans 5:1). In a world of noise, confusion, and continuous pressure, people long for peace. Many give up the search, thinking it is impossible to find, but true peace of heart and mind is available to us through faith in Jesus Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, It is so wonderful to have the peace that comes from having a personal relationship with Jesus Christ. I pray that peace would become real to the whole world. Bless and keep my e-mail friends safe. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When we worship God, only
our best is good enough...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Grace and peace to you from God our Father and our
Lord Jesus Christ...(I Cor. 1:3)

Our Lesson for Today:

As we think about this letter of Paul's we see a quite different greeting
than what we use in our letters today...But what a wonderful greeting
it would be to be reminded of God's wonderful grace...

Grace is God's free gift of salvation given to us in Christ. Receiving it 
brings us peace (Ro. 5:1)...

In a world of noise, confusion, and continuous pressure, people long
for peace. Many give up the search, thinking it is impossible to find,
but true peace of heart and mind is available to us through faith in
Jesus Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, It is so wonderful to have the peace
that comes from having a personal relationship with Jesus
Christ. I pray that peace would become real to the whole 
world...Bless and keep my e-mail friends safe...Amen.

Keep looking up, in Him there is true peace...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I can never stop thanking God for all the generous gifts He has given you, now that you belong to Christ Jesus. He has enriched your church with the gifts of eloquence and every kind of knowledge. This shows that what I told you about Christ is true. (I Corinthians 1:4-6) NLT
reflection: In this letter you will find that Paul wrote some strong words to the Corinthians ~ but he begins on a positive note of thanksgiving. He affirms their privilege of belonging to the Lord and receiving His generous gifts ~ the power to speak out for Him ~ and understand His truth. When we must correct others, it helps to begin by affirming what God has already accomplished in them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, give me wisdom like Paul shows here, help me to not only see the negative things in peoples lives but also the positive things ~ help me to always see the positive first. Bless my e-mail friends with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God knows our every thought, word, and deed...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

I can never stop thanking God for all the generous gifts He has given you,
now that you belong to Christ Jesus...

He has enriched your church with the gifts of eloquence and every kind 
of knowledge...

This shows that what I told you about Christ is true...(I Cor. 1:4-6) NLT

Our Lesson for Today:

In this letter you will find that Paul wrote some strong words to the
Corinthians ~ but he begins on a positive note of thanksgiving...

He affirms their privilege of belonging to the Lord and receiving
His generous gifts ~ the power to speak out for Him ~ and understand
His truth...

When we must correct others, it helps to begin by affirming what 
God has already accomplished in them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, give me wisdom like Paul shows here,
help me to not only see the negative things in peoples lives but
also the positive things ~ help me to always see the positive
first. Bless my e-mail friends with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, and observe the positive, 
and God will take care of the negative...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for the Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed. He will keep you strong to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ. God who has called you into fellowship with His Son Jesus Christ our Lord, is faithful. (I Corinthians 1:7-9) NIV
reflection: Paul guaranteed the Corinthian believers that God would consider them "free from blame" when Christ returns. This guarantee was not because of their great gifts or their shinning performance, but because of what Jesus Christ accomplished for them through His death and resurrection. All who have asked Jesus Christ into their heart and have a personal relationship with Him, will be considered blameless when He returns. If you have faith in Christ, even if it is weak, you are and will be saved.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I do believe, but forgive me when I stumble and fall. Take my hand and lead me in paths of righteousness. Thank You Lord for the promise of eternal life. Help me to be a better witness for You. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Confession is the key that opens 
the door to forgiveness...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly
wait for the Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed...

He will keep you strong to the end, so that you will be
blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ...

God who has called you into fellowship with His Son Jesus
Christ our Lord, is faithful...(I Cor. 1:7-9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul guaranteed the Corinthian believers that God would consider 
them "free from blame" when Christ returns...

This guarantee was not because of their great gifts or their shinning 
performance, but because of what Jesus Christ accomplished for 
them through His death and resurrection......

All who have asked Jesus Christ into their heart and have a personal 
relationship with Him, will be considered blameless when He returns.

If you have faith in Christ, even if it is weak, you are and will be saved...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I do believe, but forgive me when
I stumble and fall. Take my hand and lead me in paths of
righteousness. Thank You Lord for the promise of eternal
life. Help me to be a better witness for You...Amen.

Keep looking up ~ He has a place for You...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I appeal to you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another so that there may be no division among you and that you may be perfectly united in mind and thought. (I Corinthians 1:10) NIV
reflection: Paul had founded the church in Corinth but in a year and a half arguments and divisions arose, and some of the members of the church slipped back into an immoral lifestyle. Paul wrote this letter to address the problems and to clear up confusion about right and wrong so that they would remove the immorality from among them. The Corinthian people had a reputation for jumping from fad to fad; Paul want to keep Christianity from degenerating into just another fad. We should never, ever, seek for the perfect church, because IF we were to ever find it, and join it, it would no longer be perfect.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to see the good in my church and help me to humbly help correct what is wrong. I pray for godly-wisdom in my attempt to make my place of worship a light onto the community. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~We see in part, God sees the whole...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

I appeal to you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,
that all of you agree with one another so that there may be no
division among you and that you may be perfectly united in mind 
and thought...(I Cor. 1:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul had founded the church in Corinth but in a year and a half
arguments and divisions arose, and some of the members of 
the church slipped back into an immoral life-style...

Paul wrote this letter to address the problems and to clear up
confusion about right and wrong so that they would remove the
immorality from among them...

The Corinthian people had a reputation for jumping from fad to fad;
Paul want to keep Christianity from degenerating into just another
fad...

We should never, ever, seek for the perfect church, because IF 
we were to ever find it, and join it, it would no longer be perfect...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to see the good in my church
and help me to humbly help correct what is wrong. I pray for
godly-wisdom in my attempt to make my place of worship a
light onto the community...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the light of the world...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Let us look at verse 10 again along with verse 11) I appeal to you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another so that there be no divisions among you and that you may be perfectly united in mind and thought. My brothers, some from Chloe's household have informed me that there are quarrels among you. (I Corinthians 1:10-11) NIV
reflection: To "let there be harmony" or to allow no "divisions" and to "be of one mind, united in thought and purpose" does not require everyone to believe exactly the same. There is a difference between have opposing viewpoints and being divisive. It is very seldom that a group of people will completely agree on every issue, but we can still work together harmoniously if we agree on what truly matters ~ Jesus Christ is Lord of all. In your church, speak and behave in a way that will reduce arguments and increase harmony ~~ Petty differences should never divide Christians.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy! Instill in me a loving spirit ~ a Christ-like attitude ~ Help me be more concerned about the needs and feelings of others and less concerned about what I want. Bless all my friends with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Nice Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~He knows our every thought...

Our Bible Verse for today:
(Let us look at verse 10 again along with verse 11)

I appeal to you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,
that all of you agree with one another so that there be no divisions
among you and that you may be perfectly united in mind and thought.

My brothers, some from Chloe's household have informed me that 
there are quarrels among you...(I Cor. 1:10-11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

To "let there be harmony" or to allow no "divisions" and to 
"be of one mind, united in thought and purpose" does not 
require everyone to believe exactly the same...

There is a difference between have opposing viewpoints and 
being divisive...

It is very seldom that a group of people will completely agree 
on every issue, but we can still work together harmoniously
if we agree on what truly matters ~ Jesus Christ is Lord of all...

In your church, speak and behave in a way that will reduce
arguments and increase harmony ~~

Petty differences should never divide Christians...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy!
Instill in me a loving spirit ~ a Christ-like attitude ~ Help me
be more concerned about the needs and feelings of others
and less concerned about what I want. Bless all my e-mail
friends with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up ~ with an attitude of love...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized into the name of Paul? I am thankful that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius, so no one can say that you were baptized into my name. (I Corinthians 2:13-15) NIV
reflection: Paul's words were authoritative because their source was the Holy Spirit. Paul was not merely giving his own personal views or his personal impression of what God had said. Under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit, he wrote the very thoughts and words of God. People who refuse to believe can not understand spiritual truths, and they can not grasp the thought that God's Spirit lives in every believer. Don't expect most people to approve of or understand you decision to follow Christ. It seems so silly to them. The person who rejects Christ cannot understand truths from God's Spirit. The lines of communication have been broken, and so they will not hear what God is saying to them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that I do believe, but help me to grow even more in my faith in You. Forgive me for my sins of thought, word and deed. I pray that Your Spirit will be able to break into the heart of those who cannot find time for Your Word. Amen.
original_content:
Good Morning!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When Christ returns, we will see Him face to face...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized
into the name of Paul?

I am thankful that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,

so no one can say that you were baptized into my name...(I Cor. 2:13-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul's words were authoritative because their source was the Holy Spirit.
Paul was not merely giving his own personal views or his personal
impression of what God had said...

Under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit, he wrote the very thoughts and
words of God...

People who refuse to believe can not understand spiritual truths, and 
they can not grasp the thought that God's Spirit lives in every believer...

Don't expect most people to approve of or understand you decision
to follow Christ. It seems so silly to them...

The person who rejects Christ cannot understand truths from God's Spirit.
The lines of communication have been broken, and so they will not hear
what God is saying to them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that I do believe, but help
me to grow even more in my faith in You. Forgive me for my
sins of thought, word and deed. I pray that Your Spirit will be
able to break into the heart of those who cannot find time for
Your Word...Amen.

Keep looking up, His return is eminent...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Brothers, I could not address you as spiritual but as worldly mere infants in Christ. I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it. Indeed, you are still not ready. You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling among you, are you not worldly? are you not acting like mere men? (I Corinthians 3:1-3) NIV
reflection: Paul called the Corinthians babes in their Christian life, because they were not yet spiritually healthy and mature. The proof of this was that they quarreled like children, allowing divisions to distract them. Immature Christian are "worldly" control by their own desires; mature believers are in tune with God's desires. How much influence do your desires have on your life? Your goal should be to let God's desires be yours. Being control by your own desires will stunt your Christian growth.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to follow Your desires, that I might grow in my Christian faith. Help me to live in union with other Christians. Forgive me for allowing my own desires to take control of my life. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Nice Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~We are God's children...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Brothers, I could not address you as spiritual but as worldly mere infants
in Christ...

I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it. Indeed,
you are still not ready... 

You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling among you,
are you not worldly? are you not acting like mere men? (I Cor. 3:1-3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul called the Corinthians babes in their Christian life, because they were 
not yet spiritually healthy and mature...

The proof of this was that they quarreled like children, allowing divisions
to distract them...

Immature Christian are "worldly" control by their own desires; mature believers
are in tune with God's desires...

How much influence do your desires have on your life? Your goal should 
be to let God's desires be yours. Being control by your own desires will
stunt your Christian growth...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to follow Your desires,
that I might grow in my Christian faith. Help me to live in 
union with other Christians. Forgive me for allowing my
own desires to take control of my life...Amen.

Keep looking up, seek first His will...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul said, "I planted the seed, and Apollos watered it, but God made it grow." (I Corinthians 3:6) NIV
reflection: Paul had planted the Good News in the people's hearts. He was a missionary pioneer; he brought the message of salvation. Apollos watered the seed. He help the believers grow stronger in the faith. Paul founded the church in Corinth, and Apollos built on that foundation. Tragically, the believers in Corinth had split into different factions, pledging loyalty to different teachers. After the preacher's work is done, God is the one who makes Christians grow. Our leaders should be respected, but we should never place them on a pedestal that create barriers between people or set them up as a substitute for Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, who art the creator and sustained of all that exists, Holy is Your name above all names. Help me to become wise unto salvation, I pray for a teachable heart. Bless all my e-mail friends. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for Thought) ~~~ We cannot Hide from God...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul said, "I planted the seed, and Apollos watered it, 
but God made it grow." (I Cor. 3:6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul had planted the Good News in the people's hearts.
He was a missionary pioneer; he brought the message of 
salvation...

Apollos watered the seed. He help the believers grow stronger
in the faith. Paul founded the church in Corinth, and Apollos
built on that foundation...

Tragically, the believers in Corinth had split into different factions,
pledging loyalty to different teachers...

After the preacher's work is done, God is the one who makes
Christians grow...

Our leaders should be respected, but we should never place 
them on a pedestal that create barriers between people or set
them up as a substitute for Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, who art the creator and sustainer 
of all that exists, Holy is Your name above all names. Help me 
to become wise unto salvation, I pray for a teachable heart.
Bless all my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is looking for a closer walk with you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says, So neither he who plants nor waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow. The man who plants and the man who waters have one purpose, and each will be rewarded according to his own labor. For we are God's fellow workers; you are God's field, God's building. (I Corinthians 2:7-9) NIV
reflection: We need to remember that God's work involves may different individuals with a variety of gifts and abilities. There are no superstars in this task, only team members performing their own special roles. We can become useful members of God's team by setting aside our desires to receive glory for what we do. Don't seek the praise that comes from people ~ it is comparatively worthless. Instead seek approval from God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better team player. Remove from me any pride that would cause me to seek the praise of my peers. Help me to remember to build others up for their humble service. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Seek first approval from God...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, So neither he who plants nor waters is anything, 
but only God, who makes things grow...

The man who plants and the man who waters have one purpose,
and each will be rewarded according to his own labor...

For we are God's fellow workers; you are God's field, God's 
building...(I Cor 2:7-9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We need to remember that God's work involves may different
individuals with a variety of gifts and abilities...

There are no superstars in this task, only team members performing
their own special roles. We can become useful members of God's 
team by setting aside our desires to receive glory for what we do...

Don't seek the praise that comes from people ~ it is comparatively
worthless. Instead seek approval from God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better team player.
Remove from me any pride that would cause me to seek the
praise of my peers. Help me to remember to build others up
for their humble service...Amen.

Keep looking up, you are in God's plan...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God has revealed it (His plan) to us by His Spirit. The Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God. (I Corinthians 2:10)
reflection: "God's deep secrets" refers to God's unfathomable nature and His whole wonderful plan ~ Jesus' death and resurrection ~ and the promise of salvation, which is revealed only to those who believe that what God says is true. Those who believe in Christ's death and resurrection and put their faith in Him will know all they need to know to be saved. This knowledge, however, can't be grasped by even the wisest people unless they accept God's message. All who reject God's message are foolish, no matter how wise the world thinks they are.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Message of salvation. Instill in me a greater sensitivity to Your Spirit's teaching that I might understand Your deep secret more fully. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Confession to God always brings His Cleansing...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

God has revealed it (His plan) to us by His Spirit. The Spirit
searches all things, even the deep things of God...(I Cor 2:10)

Our Lesson for Today:

"God's deep secrets" refers to God's unfathomable nature and
His whole wonderful plan ~ Jesus' death and resurrection ~ and 
the promise of salvation, which is revealed only to those who
believe that what God says is true...

Those who believe in Christ's death and resurrection and put 
their faith in Him will know all they need to know to be saved...

This knowledge, however, can't be grasped by even the wisest 
people unless they accept God's message...

All who reject God's message are foolish, no matter how wise
the world thinks they are...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Message of salvation.
Instill in me a greater sensitivity to Your Spirit's teaching that I might
understand Your deep secret more fully...Amen.

Keep looking up, for a greater understanding...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The man without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned. The Spiritual man makes judgments about all things, but he himself is not subject to any man's judgment. (I Corinthians 2:14, 15) NIV
reflection: Non-Christians cannot understand spiritual truths, and they cannot grasp the concept that God's spirit lives in believers. Don't expect most people to approve or understand your decision to follow Christ. It seems so silly to them. Just as a tone-deaf person cannot appreciate fine music, the person who rejects Christ cannot understand truths from God's Spirit. With the lines of communication broken, he or she won't be able to hear what God is saying to him or her.
prayer: Dear Lord I love Your Word but please Lord give me a deeper understanding of it. Guide me in a closer walk with thee. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God is able to change the vilest heart...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

The man without the Spirit does not accept the things that come
from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he 
cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned...

The Spiritual man makes judgments about all things, but he himself 
is not subject to any man's judgment...(I Cor 2:14, 15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Non-Christians cannot understand spiritual truths, and they cannot
grasp the concept that God's spirit lives in believers...

Don't expect most people to approve or understand your decision to
follow Christ. It seems so silly to them...

Just as a tone-deaf person cannot appreciate fine music, the person
who rejects Christ cannot understand truths from God's Spirit...

With the lines of communication broken, he or she won't be able to
hear what God is saying to him or her...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord I love Your Word but please Lord
give me a deeper understanding of it. Guide 
me in a closer walk with thee...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will give you discernment...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather....

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Brothers, I could not address you as spiritual but as worldly ~ mere infants in Christ. I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it. Indeed you are still not ready. You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling among you, are you not worldly? are you not acting like mere men? (I Corinthians 3:1-3) NIV
reflection: The reason Paul called the Corinthians infants in the Christian life is because they were not yet spiritually healthy and mature. The proof was in their quarreling like children, allowing differences to distract them. When we are controlled by our own desires we are acting immaturely. Mature believers are in tune with God's desires. We need to examine ourselves and ask, "How much influence do my desires have on my life? Our desires should be to let God's desires be ours. Being controlled by our own desires will stunt our spiritual growth.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a desire to always be in your will. Help me to put aside selfish desires. Help me to put your will first in my life, and then I know You will fulfill all my needs. Amen.
original_content:
Merry Christmas!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Let nothing be done through 
selfish ambition (Phil. 2:3a)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Brothers, I could not address you as spiritual but as worldly ~ 
mere infants in Christ...

I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it.
Indeed you are still not ready...

You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling 
among you, are you not worldly? are you not acting like mere
men? (I Cor. 3:1-3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The reason Paul called the Corinthians infants in the Christian life
is because they were not yet spiritually healthy and mature...

The proof was in their quarreling like children, allowing differences
to distract them...

When we are controlled by our own desires we are acting immaturely.

Mature believers are in tune with God's desires. We need to examine
ourselves and ask, "How much influence do my desires have on my life?

Our desires should be to let God's desires be ours. Being controlled
by our own desires will stunt our spiritual growth...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a desire to always
be in your will. Help me to put aside selfish desires.
Help me to put your will first in my life, and then I know
You will fulfil all my needs...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will let you know His desire for you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Neither he who plants nor he who waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow. The man who plants, and the man who waters have one purpose, and each will be rewarded according to his own labor. For we are God's fellow workers; you are God's field, God's building. (I Corinthians 3:7-9) NIV
reflection: When you really think about it God's work involves many different individuals with a variety of gifts and abilities. There are no superstars in this task. There are only team members performing their own special roles. There is no reason we cannot become useful members of God's team, All we need to do is set aside our desire to receive glory for what we do. Don't seek the praise that comes from people ~ It is comparatively worthless. Instead seek approval from God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always seek to serve you according to Your will. Help me to realize the gifts You have given me to serve as a team member. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought) Our anger often reveals the worst in us...

Our Bible verses for Today:

Neither he who plants nor he who waters is anything, but only
God, who makes things grow...

The man who plants, and the man who waters have one purpose,
and each will be rewarded according to his own labor...

For we are God's fellow workers; you are God's field, God's building.
(I Cor. 3:7-9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When you really think about it God's work involves many different 
individuals with a variety of gifts and abilities. There are no superstars
in this task...

There are only team members performing their own special roles.
There is no reason we cannot become useful members of God's team,

All we need to do is set aside our desire to receive glory for what we do.
Don't seek the praise that comes from people ~ It is comparatively worthless.
Instead seek approval from God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always seek to serve you
according to Your will. Help me to realize the gifts You have 
given me to serve as a team member...Amen.

Keep looking up, seeking to serve Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as an expert builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should be careful how he builds. For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ. (I Corinthians 3:10, 11) NIV
reflection: The foundation of the church ~ of all believers ~ is Jesus Christ. Paul laid this foundation by (preaching Christ) when he began the church in Corinth. Who ever builds the church ~ officers, teachers, preachers, parents, and others ~ must build with high-quality materials (right doctrine and right living) that meets God's standard. Paul is challenging future leaders to have sound preaching and teaching.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always do my part in making sure that Your Word is always preached properly. Help me to make sure that the doctrine that is being preached is correct. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be doers of the Word, and not hears only...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as an expert
builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should
be careful how he builds...

For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, 
which is Jesus Christ...(I Cor. 3:10, 11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The foundation of the church ~ of all believers ~ is Jesus Christ...

Paul laid this foundation by (preaching Christ) when he began the 
church in Corinth...

Who ever builds the church ~ officers, teachers, preachers, parents,
and others ~ must build with high-quality materials (right doctrine and
right living) that meets God's standard...

Paul is challenging future leaders to have sound preaching and teaching...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, help me to always do my part in making
sure that Your Word is always preached properly. 
Help me to make sure that the doctrine that is being
preached is correct...Amen.

Keep looking up, for godly wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If any man builds on his foundation using gold, sliver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw, his work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of each man's work. if what he has built survives, he will receive his reward. If it is burned up, he will suffer loss; he himself will be saved, but only as one escaping through the flames. I Corinthians 3:12-15) NIV
reflection: Two sure ways to destroy a building are to tamper with the foundation and to build with inferior materials. The church must be built on Christ, not on any other person or principle. Christ will evaluate each minister's contribution to the life of the church, and judgment day will reveal the sincerity of each person's work. God will determine whether or not a person has been faithful to Jesus' instructions. Good work will be rewarded, unfaithful or inferior work will be discounted."The builders themselves will be saved, but like one escaping through a wall of flames" means that unfaithful workers will be saved but only by the skin of their teeth. All their accomplishments will count for nothing.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me become more faithful in my works for You. May I never shirk my duties to You. Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety today. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Nice Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Love as Your Master loves you...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

If any man builds on his foundation using gold, sliver, costly stones,
wood, hay or straw,

his work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to
light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of 
each man's work...

if what he has built survives, he will receive his reward...

If it is burned up, he will suffer loss; he himself will be saved, but only
as one escaping through the flames...I Cor 3:12-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Two sure ways to destroy a building are to tamper with the foundation
and to build with inferior materials...

The church must be built on Christ, not on any other person or principle.
Christ will evaluate each minister's contribution to the life of the church,
and judgment day will reveal the sincerity of each person's work...

God will determine whether or not a person has been faithful to Jesus'
instructions. Good work will be rewarded, unfaithful or inferior work will 
be discounted...

"The builders themselves will be saved, but like one escaping through a 
wall of flames" means that unfaithful workers will be saved but only by the
skin of their teeth...

All their accomplishments will count for nothing...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me become more faithful
in my works for You. May I never shirk my duties to You.
Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety 
today...Amen.

Keep looking up, for guidance...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple and that God's Spirit lives in you? If anyone destroys God's temple, God will destroy him; for God's temple is sacred, and you are that temple. (I Corinthians 3:16, 17) NIV
reflection: Now just as our bodies are the "Temple of the Holy Spirit" (I Corinthians 6:19), the local church or Christian community is God's temple. Just as the Jews' temple in Jerusalem was not to be destroyed, the church is not to be spoiled and ruined by divisions, controversy, or other sins as members come together to worship God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help protect my body from sin, I do not want to destroy Your temple. Create a clean heart in me. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Good day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When it is dark enough, men see the stars...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple 
and that God's Spirit lives in you?

If anyone destroys God's temple, God will destroy him;
for God's temple is sacred, and you are that temple...
(I Cor. 3:16, 17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Now just as our bodies are the "Temple of the Holy Spirit"
(I Cor. 6:19), the local church or Christian community is
God's temple...

Just as the Jews' temple in Jerusalem was not to be destroyed,
the church is not to be spoiled and ruined by divisions,
controversy, or other sins as members come together
to worship God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help protect my body from sin, 
I do not want to destroy Your temple. Create a clean 
heart in me...Amen.

Keep looking up, as He forgives our sins He cleans His temple...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not deceive yourselves. If anyone of you thinks he is wise by the standards of this age, he should become a "fool" so that he may become wise. For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God's sight. As it is written: "He catches the wise in their craftiness, and again, "The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile. So then, no more boasting about men! All things are yours. (I Corinthians 3:18-21) NIV
reflection: Paul is not telling us to neglect the pursuit of knowledge. He is warning us not to glory in the wisdom of this age ~ (this life). God's way of thinking is far above ours; He knows all the futile thoughts of the "wise". The Corinthians were boasting about the wisdom of their leaders and teachers. Their pride made them value the messengers more that the message. We are not to put our trust in anyone but God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always focus on the message and not so much on the messenger. Help me to be true to Your Word. Bless all my friends with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Nice Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~You can give without loving but
you can't love without giving...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Do not deceive yourselves. If anyone of you thinks he is wise
by the standards of this age, he should become a "fool" so that 
he may become wise...

For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God's sight. 
As it is written: "He catches the wise in their craftiness,

and again, "The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise
are futile...

So then, no more boasting about men! All things are yours.
(I Cor. 3:18-21) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul is not telling us to neglect the pursuit of knowledge.
He is warning us not to glory in the wisdom of this age ~
(this life)...

God's way of thinking is far above ours; He knows all the futile
thoughts of the "wise"...

The Corinthians were boasting about the wisdom of their leaders
and teachers. Their pride made them value the messengers 
more that the message...

We are not to put our trust in anyone but God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always focus on the message
and not so much on the messenger. Help me to be true to Your 
Word. Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, in loving service to Him...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Don't take pride in following a particular leader. Everything belongs to you. Paul, Apollis and Peter; the whole wold and life and death; the present and the future. Everything belongs to you, and you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God. (I Corinthians 3:21-23) NIV
reflection: Paul's says that both life and death are ours. While nonbelievers are victims of life, swept along by its current and wondering if there is any meaning to it, believers can use life well because they understand its true purpose. Nonbelievers can only fear death. For believers, however, death holds no terrors because Christ has conquered all fears (see I John 4:18). Death is only the beginning of eternal life with God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for revealing the purpose of life to me. Forgive me for my anxious thoughts. Help me to be more sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. Amen.
original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be a helper to the helpless...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Don't take pride in following a particular leader. Everything
belongs to you...

Paul, Apollis and Peter; the whole wold and life and death; 
the present and the future. Everything belongs to you,

and you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God...
(I Cor. 3:21-23) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul's says that both life and death are ours. While non-believers
are victims of life, swept along by its current and wondering if
there is any meaning to it, believers can use life well because
they understand its true purpose...

Non-believers can only fear death. For believers, however, 
death holds no terrors because Christ has conquered all fears
(see I Jn. 4:18).

Death is only the beginning of eternal life with God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for revealing the purpose 
of life to me. Forgive me for my anxious thoughts. Help
me to be more sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading...Amen.

Keep looking up, do what you can, leave the rest to God...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Apostles of Christ) So then, men ought to regard us as servants of Christ and as those entrusted with the secret things of God. Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must prove faithful. (I Corinthians 4:1-2) NIV
reflection: Paul urged the Corinthians to think of him, Peter, and Apollis as mere servants of Christ entrusted with the secret things of God. A servant does what his master tells him to do. We too must do what God tells us to do in the Bible and through His Holy Spirit. Each day God presents us with needs and opportunities that challenges us to do what we know is right.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to see the opportunities that You place before me. Open my eyes that I might see glimpses of truth You have for Me. Forgive me for my sins of omission. Amen.
original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Live truly, and your life will be a great and noble creed...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
(Apostles of Christ)

So then, men ought to regard us as servants of Christ and as 
those entrusted with the secret things of God...

Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must 
prove faithful...(I Cor. 4:1-2) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul urged the Corinthians to think of him, Peter, and Apollis
as mere servants of Christ entrusted with the secret things
of God...

A servant does what his master tells him to do. We too must 
do what God tells us to do in the Bible and through His Holy
Spirit...

Each day God presents us with needs and opportunities that
challenges us to do what we know is right...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to see the opportunities 
that You place before me. Open my eyes that I might see
glimpses of truth You have for Me. Forgive me for my sins
of omission...Amen.

Keep looking up, humbly [correct] those who have gone astray...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
